post: Investigating a Dated Piece of the Shroud of Turin “RADIOCARBON, Vol 52, Nr 4, 2010, p 1521–1527 © 2010 by the Arizona Board of Regents on behalf of the University of Arizona1521 INVESTIGATING A DATED PIECE OF THE SHROUD OF TURIN Rachel A Freer Waters Arizona State Museum, University of Arizona, Tucson, Arizona 85721, USA. Corresponding author. Email: jull@email.arizona.edu.” “Figure 5 High magnification image of a fiber bundle, showing the presence of a cotton fiber, unidentified fibers, and debris. This area appears to have been exposed to more contamination than other samples.” http://digitalcommons.arizona.edu/objectviewer?o=http%3 A%2 F%2 Fradiocarbon.library.arizona.edu%2 F Volume52%2 F Number4%2 F33737617 d6e4 4797 ba23 fb8e0f303abe UNIDENTIFIED FIBERS? ARIZONA STATE MUSEUM 11:46 “……the picture above is of fibers pulled out of that small piece of textile, again photographed in cross polarized light. The purpose of doing that is to actually identify what fiber this particular textile was made from, whether it´s cotton or linen or wool. Different fibers can be.” ¡OOOOOOHHH! Carlos.
title: New Paper by Pam Moon
